s.text: The Globe notes conspiratorially that his wife, Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy, was "nowhere in sight."
So much love is in the air that a number of stars are flying back into their former lovers' arms--or at least trying to.

Royal wedding intrigue dominates, with the Globe raising the possibility that Prince Edward may be gay--perhaps forgetting that only a week earlier, it had him confessing that he was actually in love with his late sister-in-law, Princess Diana.
How about the Globe 's report that at the bash to celebrate her Saturday Night Live appearance, Monica Lewinsky "hit the buffet table like a toothy tornado"?
How about the Globe 's report that at the bash to celebrate her Saturday Night Live appearance, Monica Lewinsky "hit the buffet table like a toothy tornado"?
And the Globe 's hit list goes on.
How about the Globe 's report that at the bash to celebrate her Saturday Night Live appearance, Monica Lewinsky "hit the buffet table like a toothy tornado"?
How about the Globe 's report that at the bash to celebrate her Saturday Night Live appearance, Monica Lewinsky "hit the buffet table like a toothy tornado"?
Can it be coincidence that the Star claims it was a "wacky seaweed therapy" that helped "hefty and hippy" Sophie Rhys-Jones drop 20 pounds before her recent wedding to Britain's Price Edward?

Royal wedding intrigue dominates, with the Globe raising the possibility that Prince Edward may be gay--perhaps forgetting that only a week earlier, it had him confessing that he was actually in love with his late sister-in-law, Princess Diana.

The Enquirer says that actress Bridget Fonda is "stocking up on bridal magazines," while country singer Dwight Yoakam shops for her engagement ring, despite a concurrent report in the Globe that a "heartsick" Fonda "can't find Mr. Right."

Confidential to Martin: You might have had a better chance of getting your money had the Globe not run a "World Exclusive" interview in which you're quoted disclosing "titillating details" about your ex's sexual fantasies and happy-hour proclivities.
